remarks: There is a natural one-to-one mapping from ` ( RR X. RR ) ` to ` CC ` , where we map ` <. x , y >. ` to ` ( x + ( _i x. y ) ) ` .  In our construction of the complex numbers, this is in fact our _definition_ of ` CC ` (see ~ df-c ), but in the axiomatic treatment we can only show that there is the expected mapping between these two sets.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Jun-2013.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 17-Feb-2014.)
statement:
cnref1o.1 $e |- F = ( x e. RR , y e. RR |-> ( x + ( _i x. y ) ) ) $.
cnref1o $p |- F : ( RR X. RR ) -1-1-onto-> CC $.
$d x y $.
